citations.narrative:
During inspection, records review identified that multiple shipments of non-human primates within the last year did not
maintain a record of the health certificate issued by the licensed veterinarian for shipments dated 14 July 2024 from New
York to Missouri, 14 November 2024 from New York to Florida, 11 February 2025 from New Hampshire to Texas and 18
February 25 from Arizona to Washington.
USDA regulation requires that the accepting carrier or intermediate handler shall keep and maintain a copy of the health
certification completed as required by 2.78, tendered with each nonhuman primate transport.
Correct by 15 May 2025 for all future nonhuman primate shipments.

During inspection, records review identified that multiple shipments of non-human primates within the last year were
accepted with a health certificate that was dated more than 10 days before the date of shipment. Specific shipments
include 10 January 2025 from Florida to Nevada and 16 June 2025 from Florida to Quebec, Canada.
USDA regulations require that no intermediate handler or carrier to whom any live nonhuman primate is delivered for
transportation.. in commerce unless, and until it is accompanied by a health certificate issued by a licensed veterinarian in
accordance with paragraph (a), which is within ten days of shipment.
Correct by 15 May 2025 for all future nonhuman primate shipments.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
William Campbell, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.77(b) 
   
Records: Carriers and intermediate handlers. 
During inspection, records review identified that multiple shipments of non-human primates within the last year did not 
maintain a record of the health certificate issued by the licensed veterinarian for shipments dated 14 July 2024 from New 
York to Missouri, 14 November 2024 from New York to Florida, 11 February 2025 from New Hampshire to Texas and 18 
February 25 from Arizona to Washington. 
 
USDA regulation requires that the accepting carrier or intermediate handler shall keep and maintain a copy of the health 
certification completed as required by 2.78, tendered with each nonhuman primate transport. 
 
Correct by 15 May 2025 for all future nonhuman primate shipments. 
2.78(c) 
   
Health certification and identification. 
During inspection, records review identified that multiple shipments of non-human primates within the last year were 
accepted with a health certificate that was dated more than 10 days before the date of shipment. Specific shipments 
include 10 January 2025 from Florida to Nevada and 16 June 2025 from Florida to Quebec, Canada. 
 
USDA regulations require that no intermediate handler or carrier to whom any live nonhuman primate is delivered for 
transportation.. in commerce unless, and until it is accompanied by a health certificate issued by a licensed veterinarian in 
accordance with paragraph (a), which is within ten days of shipment.  
 
Correct by 15 May 2025 for all future nonhuman primate shipments. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.

Additional Inspectors: 
William Campbell, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
